pullRequest.body:
- `IsSepClosure.isAlgClosure_of_perfectField`, `IsSepClosure.of_isAlgClosure_of_perfectField`: if `k` is a perfect field, then its separable closure coincides with its algebraic closure.
- `IsSepClosed.isAlgClosed_of_perfectField`: a separably closed perfect field is also algebraically closed.
- `Algebra.IsAlgebraic.[isSeparable_of_]perfectField`: if `L / K` is an algebraic extension, `K` is a perfect field, then `L / K` is separable and `L` is perfect.

---

There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/3e43badf-c69e-49d7-acc3-7b1b567e60fb/to/20ba2498-8802-4a26-90d1-316b6c9c425a) against commit a7c1abf55b6ba5e31f1ff40d07ada10b980d6e4b:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================================================
- ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.FilteredColimitCommutesFiniteLimit   instructions    16.4%
```

(discussion [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9522#discussion_r1444117772). This slowed-down file doesn't import any file that is changed. - Junyan)

bors d+

```suggestion
instance (priority := 100) isAlgClosed_of_perfectField [IsSepClosed k] [PerfectField k] :
```
Or else lean finds this first whenever it looks for `IsAlgClosed k`
same for the new instances below

This two instances certainly form a loop. Is it desirable to have both as instances? Or maybe an iff lemma is better? (`IsAlgClosure k K` iff `IsSepClosure k K` should be true under either `PerfectField k` or `PerfectField K`.)

> This two instances certainly form a loop.

Yes. Will it break the instance search? Since `IsSepClosure` is a `Prop`, any two of them are the same, I assume that Lean uses BFS or DFS on graph, and the visited node will not search the second time. Will the existence of loops affect it?

I'm OK if write them as `theorem` instead of `instance`.

Lean 3 can't have instance loops; Lean 4 allows them but they can lead to performance issues. Since this file isn't imported much may be it won't manifest from benchmarking results, but let me bench it and ask what @erdOne thinks about it...
Hmm I have no idea why a file that doesn't import either of the two changed file got slowed down. I'd consider it a false report and personally I think your instances are good to go.

Can you extract the lemma that says if L/K is integral with L a field and K a CommRing, then any irreducible polynomial in L[X] divides some monic irreducible polynomial in K[X]?

(Side comment: I think we can also prove it for an integrally closed domain L if we assume `Monic` because we have [minpoly.isIntegrallyClosed_dvd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/Minpoly/IsIntegrallyClosed.html#minpoly.isIntegrallyClosed_dvd) and [IsIntegrallyClosed.minpoly.unique](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/Minpoly/IsIntegrallyClosed.html#IsIntegrallyClosed.minpoly.unique). For L/K free maybe we can use Algebra.norm, but I'm not sure whether every element divides its norm in a general algebra; even though we can factor into irreducibles in a Noetherian domain, we probably need to start with a prime (not just irreducible) polynomial in L[X] in order for it to divide some factor ... there could be a version that assumes IsAlgebraic instead of IsIntegral too. But not for this PR ...)
Sure, let me check later.

> Can you extract the lemma that says if L/K is integral with L a field and K a CommRing, then any irreducible polynomial in L[X] divides some monic irreducible polynomial in K[X]?

Need `IsDomain K` (used in `minpoly.irreducible`). Can it be deduced from existing conditions?

[EDIT] If let `K'` be the image of `K` in `L`, then it is a domain, so at least we can find a monic irreducible polynomial in `K'[X]`. The question is if its preimage in `K[X]` is still irreducible.

I see. There's no obvious way to remove IsDomain as far as I can see. If K is not a domain, it's possible that the minpoly has higher degree factors that become units in L[X].
Let's move this lemma to the file where AdjoinRoot is defined and call it a day!

> > Can you extract the lemma that says if L/K is integral with L a field and K a CommRing, then any irreducible polynomial in L[X] divides some monic irreducible polynomial in K[X]?
> 
> Need `IsDomain K` (used in `minpoly.irreducible`).

This result is incorrect, at least when `K` is not connected (i.e. can be written as a product of two rings), see https://math.stackexchange.com/a/4849403/235999. In fact, it's easy to prove that for such case, any monic polynomial in `K[X]` of degree `â‰¥ 1` is NOT irreducible (a non-trivial factorization is obtained by applying Chinese Remainder Theorem on `f * 1` and `1 * f`).

On the other hand, it's true if `K` is irreducible (i.e. only one minimal prime ideal), see https://math.stackexchange.com/a/4843432/235999.
Doesn't this imply that $\text{Frac} K$ is integral over $K$, i.e. $K$ is actually a field?
K to L isn't necessarily injective (K could be L[X] and `algebraMap K L` could be evaluation at 0, for example). That said, I think this is still true if IsIntegral is replaced by IsAlgebraic ...
Can you add this to the docstring at the beginning of the file?
Also, can this be an instance?

> Can you add this to the docstring at the beginning of the file?

Sure.



> Also, can this be an instance?

No, it's not possible I think, since `Algebra.IsAlgebraic` is not a typeclass, so this condition must be provided manually.
